document_data.caption: A giant crane wades in some water.
document_data.name: Giant Crane
document_data.mainbody: '''Giant cranes''' were a monstrously sized species of [[crane]].
document_data.Behavior: These creatures had an average animal degree of intelligence. Though generally non-aggressive, giant cranes were very protective of their mates, young, and nesting areas.

Ecology.Diet: These creatures were a carnivorous species, preying upon large [[fish]].
Ecology.Habitats:
Giant cranes were generally found in the same habitats of similar wading birds, such as ordinary cranes, [[heron]]s, and bitterns. These habitats included marshes, swamps, lake verges, and along the banks of watercourses.

Giant cranes could be found in [[Kara-Tur]]'s temperate plains, as well as in its tropical and sub-tropical swamps.
